title: Ticket #3902: condor_submit - no longer means read from stdin
description:
condor_submit - no longer ends up meaning read config file from stdin. this ends up breaking condor_qsub which depends on this behavior.

The following patch will fix condor_qsub. It would be fantastic if this was incorporated in the next release. 

--- /usr/bin/condor_qsub	2013-07-24 12:45:27.000000000 +0200
+++ /home/raid3/gorgolewski/bin/condor_qsub	2013-09-09 11:06:12.865587821 +0200
@@ -1100,7 +1100,7 @@
 	if [ -n "$job_deps" ]; then
 	sentinel_file="$(mktemp --tmpdir cluster${cluster_id}_sentinel.XXXXXXXXXXXXX)"
 	create_dep_sentinel $sentinel_file "$job_deps" "$cluster_id"
-	condor_submit - < $sentinel_file.submit > /dev/null
+	condor_submit < $sentinel_file.submit > /dev/null
 	[ $condor_keep_files -eq 0 ] && rm $sentinel_file.submit || true
 	fi
 else
remarks:
2013-Sep-10 14:19:04 by johnkn:
After looking at the code. it seems that there was never explicit support for - as an argument to condor_submit. What has happening is that before condor_submit -interactive was added, condor submit - was being parsed as condor_submit -verbose. Then the lack of a submit filename was causing it to read from stdin. When -interactive was added, it was added before -verbose and condor_submit - now means condor_submit -interactive.

I'm going to patch this for stable by moving the parsing of -interactive until after -verbose. That will restore the original behavior. In devel we should also fix it so that there is an explicit check for - to mean read from stdin. We should also change it so that multiple submit files can be supplied, with - interpreted as a special case for filename.

2013-Sep-13 11:33:36 by tannenba:
